title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. Let X denote the amount of change carried by a daytime statistics student. We are told that X is approximately normally distributed with mean μ $$=$$ $$0.88$$ and standard deviation σ $$=$$ $$0.10$$.

$$2$$. We want $$P(0.80$$ < X < $$1.00)$$. To find this probability for a normal distribution, we convert each boundary to a $$z-score$$:

$$z$$ $$=$$ (x - μ) / σ.

For $$x$$ $$=$$ $$0.80$$:
z₁ $$=$$ $$(0.80$$ - $$0.88)$$ / $$0.10$$ $$=$$ $$-0.08$$ / $$0.10$$ $$=$$ $$-0.8$$.

For $$x$$ $$=$$ $$1.00$$:
z₂ $$=$$ $$(1.00$$ - $$0.88)$$ / $$0.10$$ $$=$$ $$0.12$$ / $$0.10$$ $$=$$ $$1.2$$.

$$3$$. Thus we seek $$P(-0.8$$ < Z < $$1.2)$$ where Z is a standard normal random variable (mean $$0$$, standard deviation 1).
